meanings.definition: To revert to a worse condition or behavior.
meanings.sent1: After trying to improve his grades, he backslid and started skipping classes again.
meanings.sent2: She had been making progress in her recovery, but unfortunately, she backslid after a stressful event.
meanings.sent3: The cat backslid on its promise to not knock over any more plants.
meanings.sent4: The town's economy backslid into a recession despite efforts to boost it.
meanings.sent5: The once vibrant garden backslid into a state of neglect and overgrowth.

meanings.sent1: His health backslid after he stopped following his doctor's advice.
meanings.sent2: The old building continued to backslid in condition due to lack of maintenance.
meanings.sent3: The quality of the product backslid so much that customers started complaining.
meanings.sent4: The relationship between the two countries backslid into tension and conflict.
meanings.sent5: The team's performance backslid as they faced tougher opponents.

meanings.definition: To lapse in religious faith or practice.
meanings.sent1: She backslid in her commitment to attend church every Sunday.
meanings.sent2: He felt guilty after he backslid and missed his prayers for a week.
meanings.sent3: The nun jokingly said she backslid when she couldn't resist eating the last cookie.
meanings.sent4: The community was concerned when they noticed many members starting to backslid in their religious observance.
meanings.sent5: The pastor's sermon reminded the congregation not to backslid in their faith during difficult times.
